definitions: person who speaks and understands two languages with fluency
characteristic or quality of using or involving two languages
examples: The bilingual teacher could explain concepts in both English and Spanish
Many bilinguals switch between languages depending on the social context
The company requires bilingual signage in all public areas
Her bilingual abilities made her an ideal candidate for international relations

definitions: state or condition of being able to speak and understand two languages fluently
examples: Bilingualism offers cognitive advantages beyond simple language skills
The school promotes bilingualism through immersive language programs

definitions: statement of charges for goods or services requiring payment
draft of proposed legislation presented for approval
paper currency used as legal tender
hard projecting mouth part of a bird
printed advertisement or public notice displayed on walls
examples: The restaurant bill came to more than we expected
She always pays her utility bills on time
Congress will vote on the healthcare bill next week
The senator introduced a bill to reform education funding
He paid with a twenty dollar bill for the coffee
The vending machine only accepts bills, not coins
The pelican's bill can hold several fish at once
The toucan's colorful bill helps regulate its body temperature
They posted bills advertising the concert throughout the city
Old theater bills covered the vintage shop's walls

definitions: isolated pond or pool of water left behind after a river changes course
examples: The kangaroos gathered around the billabong to drink
Aboriginal stories often feature spirits dwelling in billabongs

definitions: large outdoor board for displaying advertisements typically beside roads
examples: The new billboard advertised upcoming movie releases
Digital billboards can change their displays every few seconds

definitions: temporary accommodation for soldiers typically in civilian homes
thick bar of metal prepared for further processing
thick piece of wood used as fuel or construction material
examples: The soldiers received billets in local farmhouses during training
Each recruit was assigned a billet near the base
The steel billet will be rolled into sheets at the factory
Workers heated the aluminum billets before extrusion
He stacked the oak billets beside the fireplace
The carpenter selected straight billets for the frame

definitions: order of importance given to performers in entertainment credits
process of preparing and sending invoices for payment
examples: She received top billing in the Broadway production
The billing listed him as a special guest star
The hospital's billing department handles insurance claims
Monthly billing occurs on the first of each month

definitions: number equal to one thousand million or 1,000,000,000
examples: The company's valuation exceeded three billion dollars
Earth's population surpassed eight billion people recently

definitions: person whose wealth equals or exceeds one billion monetary units
examples: The tech billionaire donated half his fortune to charity
Several billionaires competed to develop commercial space travel

definitions: portable metal pot used for boiling water over campfire
informal term for a male goat
short wooden club used as weapon by police
examples: The campers boiled water in the billy for tea
He hung the billy over the campfire on a tripod
The old billy goat guarded the herd aggressively
That billy has impressive curved horns
The officer carried a billy club on his belt
Victorian police once used wooden billies for crowd control

definitions: derogatory term for an attractive but seemingly unintelligent person, typically female
examples: The movie stereotype of the blonde bimbo is outdated and offensive
She resented being dismissed as just another bimbo

definitions: occurring or produced twice in one month
occurring or produced once every two months
examples: The bimonthly meetings happen on the first and fifteenth
She receives bimonthly paychecks from her employer
The bimonthly magazine publishes six issues per year
Their bimonthly newsletter arrives in January, March, and May

definitions: container for disposing of garbage or waste materials
compartment or container used for storing bulk materials or items
examples: Please throw the wrapper in the recycling bin
The garbage bin needs emptying every Tuesday morning
The grain bin holds enough wheat for winter feeding
She organized her craft supplies in plastic storage bins

definitions: something composed of or involving two things or parts
number system using only digits 0 and 1
data or code represented using only two states in computing
examples: The binary star system contains two orbiting suns
Gender as a binary concept is increasingly questioned
Students learned to convert decimal numbers to binary
Binary arithmetic uses only zeros and ones
The file stores information in binary format
Computers process all data as binary code internally

definitions: something that ties or restrains physically
material or method used to hold book pages together
difficult or restrictive situation from which escape is hard
examples: The prisoner struggled against the binds on his wrists
They used rope binds to secure the cargo
The leather bind on the ancient book had deteriorated
Gold leaf decorated the book's ornate bind
Finding herself in a bind, she had to choose quickly
The contract put them in a legal bind

definitions: ring folder or cover for holding loose papers together
substance that holds other materials together in mixture
machine or person that binds books or documents
examples: She organized her class notes in a three-ring binder
The recipe collection filled several binders
Egg acts as a binder in many baking recipes
The paint binder determines its adhesion properties
The automatic binder can process hundreds of documents daily
The professional binder restored the antique volumes

definitions: protective covering or edging of a book holding pages together
formal agreement or decision that must be followed legally
strip of material used to bind edges or seams
examples: The book's leather binding showed signs of age
She chose a hardcover binding for durability
The court's binding decision cannot be appealed
They signed a binding contract for the property
The quilt needed new binding around its edges
She sewed bias binding along the dress hem

definitions: period of excessive indulgence in an activity, especially eating or drinking
examples: His weekend Netflix binge lasted twelve hours straight
She went on a shopping binge after receiving her bonus

definitions: game where players mark off numbers on cards as they are randomly called
examples: Every Friday night they play bingo at the community center
She shouted bingo when she completed the winning pattern

definitions: scientist who studies chemical processes within and relating to living organisms
examples: The biochemist discovered a new enzyme in bacterial cells
Several biochemists collaborated on developing the vaccine

definitions: scientific study of chemical processes within and relating to living organisms
examples: She majored in biochemistry to pursue medical research
Biochemistry explains how proteins fold into functional shapes

definitions: measures and strategies to protect against biological warfare or naturally occurring disease outbreaks
examples: The government increased biodefense funding after the anthrax attacks
Biodefense research focuses on developing vaccines against weaponized pathogens

definitions: variety of plant and animal life in a particular habitat or ecosystem
examples: The rainforest's biodiversity includes millions of species
Climate change threatens global biodiversity in unprecedented ways

definitions: application of engineering principles to biological systems for medical or industrial purposes
examples: Bioengineering produced artificial organs for transplant patients
The university's bioengineering department develops prosthetic limbs

definitions: technique using electronic monitoring to train control of normally automatic bodily functions
examples: Biofeedback helped her manage chronic pain without medication
Athletes use biofeedback to optimize their breathing patterns

definitions: scientific study of the geographical distribution of plants and animals
examples: Biogeography explains why marsupials dominate in Australia
Island biogeography theory predicts species diversity patterns

definitions: person who writes an account of someone else's life
examples: The biographer spent years researching Churchill's private papers
Several biographers competed to write the authorized life story

definitions: written account of a person's life written by someone else
examples: The biography revealed unknown details about Einstein's childhood
She read several biographies of famous women scientists

definitions: biological substance that poses a threat to human health or environment
examples: Medical waste requires special biohazard disposal procedures
The laboratory displayed biohazard warning symbols prominently

definitions: scientist who studies living organisms and their relationships to environment
examples: The marine biologist discovered a new species of deep-sea fish
Field biologists track animal migration patterns annually

definitions: scientific study of living organisms including their structure, function, growth, and evolution
examples: Biology class included dissecting frogs to understand anatomy
Modern biology relies heavily on molecular techniques

definitions: production and emission of light by living organisms through chemical reactions
examples: Fireflies create bioluminescence to attract mates
Deep-sea creatures use bioluminescence for hunting and communication

definitions: large naturally occurring community of flora and fauna occupying a major habitat
examples: The tundra biome experiences extremely cold temperatures year-round
Each biome supports unique adaptations in its resident species

definitions: branch of medical science applying biological and physiological principles to clinical practice
examples: Biomedicine research led to targeted cancer therapies
The biomedicine conference featured breakthrough gene therapy presentations

definitions: medical procedure extracting sample cells or tissues for examination to determine disease presence
examples: The doctor ordered a biopsy to check for cancer cells
The liver biopsy results came back negative

definitions: use of living organisms to remove or neutralize environmental pollutants
examples: Bioremediation bacteria cleaned the oil spill naturally
The contaminated soil underwent bioremediation for two years

definitions: prevention of large-scale loss of biological integrity focusing on ecology and human health
examples: The laboratory follows strict biosafety protocols
Biosafety regulations prevent accidental pathogen release

definitions: any of the life sciences dealing with living organisms and life processes
examples: The bioscience industry attracts significant venture capital investment
She pursued a career in bioscience after completing her doctorate

definitions: regions of Earth's surface and atmosphere occupied by living organisms
examples: The biosphere extends from deep ocean trenches to mountain peaks
Human activities increasingly impact the global biosphere

definitions: animal and plant life in a particular region or period
examples: Scientists studied the cave's unique biota
The island's biota evolved in isolation for millions of years

definitions: biotechnology or the biotechnology industry sector
examples: The biotech startup developed revolutionary gene editing tools
Investors poured billions into biotech companies last year

definitions: exploitation of biological processes for industrial and other purposes, especially genetic manipulation
examples: Biotechnology produced insulin using genetically modified bacteria
Agricultural biotechnology created drought-resistant crop varieties

definitions: deliberate release of viruses, bacteria, or other germs to cause illness or death
examples: Security agencies prepare for potential bioterrorism attacks
The anthrax letters represented the first major bioterrorism incident

definitions: airplane with two pairs of wings, one above the other
examples: The vintage biplane performed aerial stunts at the airshow
Early aviation pioneers preferred biplanes for their stability

definitions: slender deciduous tree with distinctive white bark that peels in layers
examples: The silver birch trees created a stunning autumn display
Native Americans used birch bark to make waterproof canoes

definitions: warm-blooded vertebrate with feathers, wings, and a beak that typically can fly
examples: The early bird catches the worm, as they say
Migrating birds travel thousands of miles each season

definitions: cage designed to house pet birds, typically made of wire or bars
examples: The canary sang cheerfully from its ornate birdcage
She cleaned the birdcage and refilled the water dish

definitions: golf score of one stroke under par for a hole
informal or affectionate term for a small bird
examples: She made a birdie on the difficult par-four hole
The professional golfer scored three birdies in the final round
Look at that cute little birdie in the garden
The children fed breadcrumbs to the birdies

definitions: musical sounds made by birds, especially in the morning
examples: Dawn birdsong filled the forest with natural melody
Scientists study birdsong to understand animal communication

definitions: emergence of a baby or offspring from the mother's body
beginning or origin of something significant
examples: The birth of their first child changed everything
She gave birth to healthy twins last night
The Renaissance marked the birth of modern science
We witnessed the birth of a new political movement
